title: Plasmide56
author: Plasmide56
created_time: July 19, 2022, 11:14:21 PMLast edit: July 22, 2022, 04:10:02 PM by Plasmide56
content: I got a problem yesterday to transfer 4900 USD with my Trezor wallet opened by the new Electrum wallet version. I got the message : RuntimeError('DataError: Input does not match scriptPubKey'). It's happened only when I wanted to send the Bitcoin. I was able to open my Trezor with Electrum wallet in the first place. I thought my Trezor was broken with 4900 us $ in It. I have discovered with try and error and cold sweat that I needed to enter my password without any error for the firs time the window appeared and I needed to avoid the Trezor to lock after inactivity when the Bitcoin Electrum Wallet was on. I'm a computer technician and got cold sweat for a long time and I use crypto Electrum since 2018. One more thing, The same transaction fee was 1% a year ago to 1.6% on this website and bitay in now 8% for the conversion.  By this I can correlate the exchange use debt to make the conversion because since the Fed rate went up, the price have increased.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: Plasmide56 on July 19, 2022, 11:14:21 PMI got a problem yesterday to transfer 4900 USD with my Trezor wallet opened by the new Electrum wallet version. I got the message : RuntimeError('DataError: Input does not match scriptPubKey'). It's happened only when I wanted to send the Bitcoin. I was able to open my Trezor with Electrum wallet in the first place. I thought my Trezor was broken with 4900 us $ in It. I have discovered with try and error and cold sweat that I needed to enter my password without any error for the firs time the window appeared and I needed to avoid the Trezor to lock after inactivity when the Bitcoin Electrum Wallet was on. I'm a computer technician and got cold sweat for a long time and I use crypto Electrum since 2018. One more thing, The same transaction fee was 1% a year ago to 1.6% on this website and bitay in now 8% for the conversion.  By this I can correlate the exchange use debt to make the conversion because since the Fed rate went up, the price have increased.It is not the same error as in Bitcoin Core, as Electrum does not re-use any Bitcoin Core code. You appeared to have deduced that the problem was coming from your locked Trezor, but I advise you in the future to post topics like this in the "Electrum" child board.
